results.name: Emma Byrnes
results.biography: Emma Byrmes worked as a web designer as well as studying interactive media at Victoria University. After graduating in 2001, Byrnes decided to make a shift from virtual to real environments. She now owns PLUMP Organic Grocery in Yarraville. For any future interactive projects Byrnes would like to draw inspiration from her current life situation - "a fruit and vegetable extravaganza, perhaps"?

results.name: Danielle Karalus
results.biography: Danielle Karalus is a new media designer and interactive filmmaker interested in exploring emerging technologies and new ways to engage the viewer and deliver stories through images, video and sound. Her interactive fiolm, shocked, has exhibted extensively in Australia and internationally. Danielle has also curated the new media exhibiton of the Australian WOW Internationl Film Festival, 2002.

results.name: Ruth Fleishman
results.biography: Ruth Fleishman has lectured in the Art and Multimedia Departments of Victoria University, Deakin Unversity and Homesglen Tafe. She exhibited her work ¿spacejunk¿ in Experimenta's ¿Waste¿ program and at Electrofringe, NSW in 2001. As well as attending year Siggraph with !Oink, she was accepted to participate in Time_Place_Space, Hybrid Art Workshop at Charles Sturt University, Wagga Wagga. This was facilitated by Performance Space, Sydney. Ruth's work 'Vietnam-A Psychic Guide' received grants from The Australia Council, Myer Foundation and Arts Victoria and was shown at the North Melbourne Town Hall in August 2003.
